revised_title: Molecular Dynamics Simulations of Polar Liquids: Dielectric Properties and Dynamic Behavior
tldr: This article presents a computer simulation study of polar liquids, focusing on their static and dynamic dielectric properties. The Berne-Pechukas-Kushick potential is used as the model for polar liquids in a series of molecular dynamics simulations. Results for thermodynamic properties, distribution functions, and dielectric constants are discussed, along with the behavior of cross-correlations between dipole orientations and their importance to dielectric relaxation.
